name: vscode-julia-formatter
description: A formatter for the Julia language

juliaFormatter.overwriteFlags.description: If `true` accepts flag values passed from vs-code interface rather than default values of specified style.

juliaFormatter.compile.description: Control the compilation level of Julia. Available values are 'min' or 'all'.

juliaFormatter.margin.description: The maximum number of characters of code on a single line. Lines over the limit will be wrapped if possible. There are cases where lines cannot be wrapped and they will still end up wider than the requested margin.

juliaFormatter.indent.description: The number of spaces used for an indentation.

juliaFormatter.alwaysForIn.description: Always replaces `=` with `in` for `for` loops. For example, `for i = 1:10` will be transformed to `for i in 1:10`.

juliaFormatter.whitespaceTypedefs.description: If `true`, whitespace is added for type definitions. Make this `true` if you prefer `Union{A <: B, C}` to `Union{A<:B,C}`.

juliaFormatter.whitespaceOpsInIndices.description: If `true`, whitespace is added for binary operations in indices. Make this `true` if you prefer `arr[a + b]` to `arr[a+b]`.

juliaFormatter.removeExtraNewlines.description: If `true`, superflous newlines will be removed.

juliaFormatter.importToUsing.description: If `true`, `import` expressions are rewritten to `using` expressions.

juliaFormatter.shortToLongFunctionDef.description: Transforms a short function definition to a long function definition.

juliaFormatter.alwaysUseReturn.description: If `true`, `return` will be prepended to the last expression where applicable in function definitions, macro definitions, and do blocks.

juliaFormatter.whitespaceInKwargs.description: If `true`, `=` in keyword arguments will be surrounded by whitespace.

juliaFormatter.annotateUntypedFieldsWith.description: If `true`, annotates fields in a type definitions with `::Any` if no type annotation is provided (Requires `JuliaFormatter.jl v0.6.3`).

juliaFormatter.formatDocstrings.description: If `true`, format code docstrings with the same options used for the code source.

juliaFormatter.alignAssignment.description: If `true`, align to `=`-like operators. This covers variable assignments and short definition functions.

juliaFormatter.alignStructField.description: If `true`, align struct field definitions to `::` or `=` - whichever has higher precedence.

juliaFormatter.alignConditional.description: If `true`, align conditional expressions to either `?`, `:`, or both.

juliaFormatter.sysimagePath.description: The Julia system image to use with Julia's `--sysimage` argument. If left blank, no system image will be used.
